oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Current status of adult cattle vaccination with Strain 19 in Florida
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nicoletti, Paul
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bacterial diseases
brucellosis
Complement fixation tests
Diagnostic techniques
Disease control
Dosage
Immunization
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Vaccination of adult cattle with 1/25th of the standard dose of strain 19 reduced the number of cattle removed from 110 herds in one year by 85% in 85 dairy herds and by 90% in 25 beef herds. This dose also minimized the effects of false positive reactions to serological tests. Complement fixation was found to be superior to other tests for diagnosing infection in vaccinated cattle.
